snippet.title: Awesome Game Playthrough
snippet.description:
A game that Nifflas was commissioned to make by Kulturverket and Humlab Umeå. Under the original agreement, it wasn't meant to be released to the public. But some time after streaming it, Nifflas apparently managed to obtain permission to release it.

Being designed by four children, it's obviously not a very good game. It's also repetitive, with three of the chapters being shooters. (Kind of depressing that this sort of gameplay is apparently the first thing that comes to many kids' minds these days.) But it does have sort of a "so bad, it's good" vibe to it, what with the silly imagery and the largely unintelligible synthesized voice narrating broken English. And it's part of Nifflas' legacy, so I'm glad we can play it now.
